item.title: Neutralizing Stressful Interactions with Tai Chi Push Hands
item.description: Last week, I asked you about stressful situations and many of you shared your responses to the Most Stressful Interaction of Your Week. Thank you for taking the time to respond. I hope the guided practice sessions I sent you in return helped bring some relaxation into your life. This week, I want to dive into some of the themes of those interactions and show you how Tai Chi, specifically the two-person interactive practices called Push Hands, trains you to respond to them.

item.title: Learning to Desire Pain as a Tai Chi Exercise
item.description: In response to Transforming Conflict with Tai Chi, many of you sent me stories of situations where you were forced into a tense encounter and you had to draw on your practice to get you through it. After, you feel relief and you can move on, but sometimes the idea slips through that, "hey, I'm a little better able to handle this kind of thing because of the way I faced it.
